intro: Casearia herbert-smithii, commonly known as Herbert-Smith's casearia, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in coastal regions and is adapted to sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
